main event: On January 2, 1953, in Hillsboro, Illinois, the observer reported seeing a couple of lights in the sky about the size of the palm of a hand held at arm's length, which suddenly burst and was too bright for car lights. The lights then went out.
interesting points: The report documented the sighting of 2 objects.
The burst was described as too bright to be car lights.
The report mentioned that at first, the observer thought it was car lights before the burst.
The location was described as near Stillsboro, 10 miles northwest of Sullivan, Champaign Co., with clear and bright moonlight.
sighted object: couple of lights in the sky
